channel.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
channel.description: How i can add another rank with admin crown? Example rank 5 i need it with admin crown, Any idea how?

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @matzie matzie
item.description:
@matzie wrote:

[quote=“Naseem, post:1, topic:468773”]How i can add another rank with admin crown?
Example rank 5 i need it with admin crown, Any idea how?[/quote]
search in client.java for

Right above it, should have

make that

edit:

never mind your not using a 317, see why it helps to TELL US THESE THINGS IN YOUR POST???

Read full topic
item.source: Adding another rank with admin crown

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @Naseem Naseem
item.description:
@Naseem wrote:

Well i just opened my client.java and i found this:

if(myPrivilege == 0){
pushMessage(s, 2, player.name);
} else if(myPrivilege == 1 || myPrivilege == 5){
pushMessage(s, 2, "@cr1@" + player.name);
} else if(myPrivilege == 2 || myPrivilege == 3){
pushMessage(s, 2, "@cr2@" + player.name);
} else if(myPrivilege == 4){
pushMessage(s, 2, "@cr3@" + player.name);
		}

Also as you see i added this " || myPrivilege == 5 "
which means playerrights 5 will have mod crown, i complied and after i just set my rights for 5 and login, i didn’t get any crown, Am i missing anything?

Read full topic

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

imstrength:

no wayyy…this is intense i might have to do this to my server…what have you started <3

Protip: Probationary Ranks are temporary and meant to test them. They can also be used as a form of stripping away a Staffer’s Power without them getting upset, or crying about the loss of their crown, etc.

You also might want to do some research on Command Hierarchy and Reverse Chain of Command.

Read full topic
item.source: Adding another rank with admin crown

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:7, topic:468773”][quote author=imstrength link=topic=585759.msg4160228#msg4160228 date=1353021020]
its going to be client sided so you are in the wrong section. i have done this on my server. basically just look up a guide for adding donator symbol and where ever it is adding the symbol for player rights 4 change that to player rights 5 and just use the admin crown image instead
[/quote]

Or add a new Rank instead of just replacing one. Better yet, remove the entire Rights System and start it from scratch. Here’s an example of decent Staff Ranking:

[quote]
20. Game-Master (In-game/Forums)

  1. Deputy Administrator (Forums)

  2. Community Manager (In-game/Forums)

  3. Assistant Community Manager (In-game/Forums)

  4. Lead Player Moderator (In-game)

  5. Senior Player Moderator (In-game)

  6. Player Moderator (In-game)

  7. Probationary Player Moderator (In-game)

  8. Lead Forum Moderator (Forums)

  9. Senior Forum Moderator (Forums)

  10. Forum Moderator (Forums)

  11. Probationary Forum Moderator (Forums)

  12. Community Watcher (Forums)

  13. Probationary Community Watcher (Forums)

  14. Server Guide (In-game/Forums)

  15. Probationary Server Guide (In-game/Forums)

  16. Forum Guide (Forums)

  17. Probationary Forum Guide (Forums)

  18. Think Tank Group (Forums)

  19. Event Planners (Forums)
    [/quote][/quote]

no wayyy…this is intense i might have to do this to my server…what have you started <3

Read full topic
item.source: Adding another rank with admin crown

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @Team_Rocket Team_Rocket
item.description:
@Team_Rocket wrote:

imstrength:

its going to be client sided so you are in the wrong section. i have done this on my server. basically just look up a guide for adding donator symbol and where ever it is adding the symbol for player rights 4 change that to player rights 5 and just use the admin crown image instead

Or add a new Rank instead of just replacing one. Better yet, remove the entire Rights System and start it from scratch. Here’s an example of decent Staff Ranking:

20. Game-Master (In-game/Forums)

  1. Deputy Administrator (Forums)

  2. Community Manager (In-game/Forums)

  3. Assistant Community Manager (In-game/Forums)

  4. Lead Player Moderator (In-game)

  5. Senior Player Moderator (In-game)

  6. Player Moderator (In-game)

  7. Probationary Player Moderator (In-game)

  8. Lead Forum Moderator (Forums)

  9. Senior Forum Moderator (Forums)

  10. Forum Moderator (Forums)

  11. Probationary Forum Moderator (Forums)

  12. Community Watcher (Forums)

  13. Probationary Community Watcher (Forums)

  14. Server Guide (In-game/Forums)

  15. Probationary Server Guide (In-game/Forums)

  16. Forum Guide (Forums)

  17. Probationary Forum Guide (Forums)

  18. Think Tank Group (Forums)

  19. Event Planners (Forums)

Read full topic

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @imstrength imstrength
item.description:
@imstrength wrote:

then cant u say this:

[code]IMPOSIBLE

Unless one of the following applies to you:

  1. You have some Java knowledge and know your way around your client and engine
  2. You use a tutorial found here on Moparscape
  3. You give up until someone that #1 or #2 applies to does it for you[/code]

about everything people need help with making this a useless post

Read full topic

item.title: Adding another rank with admin crown
item.dc:creator: @Aesyr Aesyr
item.description:
@Aesyr wrote:

[quote=“imstrength, post:4, topic:468773”][quote author=mista pnut link=topic=585759.msg4160240#msg4160240 date=1353021799]
IMPOSIBLE

Unless one of the following applies to you:

  1. You have some Java knowledge and know your way around your client and engine
  2. You use a tutorial found here on Moparscape
  3. You give up until someone that #1 or #2 applies to does it for you
    [/quote]

not true…my player rights 5 (previously had no crown) now has a green crown that i have made myself. if you do not believe me get on my server and ill show you! :D[/quote]

Then you either:

  1. Had some Java knowledge and know your way around your client and engine to the extent that you’re able to do this
  2. Used a tutorial found on the internet (in general, not specifically here)
